item.title: 新泽西州通勤缓解措施可能取决于美国大选，资金尚无着落
item.description: 在夏季列车故障导致进出纽约的通勤脱轨几个月后，能否获得更多的交通资金来解决这些问题，可能取决于周二的选举。【原文：Months after a summer of train breakdowns derailed commutes in and out of New York, more transit funding to fix the challenges could hinge on Tuesday’s election.】

item.title: 澳大利亚交易所上市新西兰债券期货面临重大障碍

item.description: 甚至在美国总统大选结果出来之前，Andreessen Horowitz 就已经向政治行动委员会 Fairshake 及其附属机构认捐了超过 2300 万美元，用于在 2026 年中期选举期间支持对加密货币友好的候选人。【原文：Even before the US presidential election results are in, Andreessen Horowitz has pledged more than $23 million to the political action committee Fairshake and its affiliates to support crypto-friendly candidates during the midterm elections in 2026.】

item.title: Uber 建议因油价下跌而削减纽约市司机最低工资
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies Inc. ）计划提出削减纽约市司机基本工资率等建议，以降低其最大市场之一的乘车价格。【原文：Uber Technologies Inc. plans to propose a cut to New York City drivers’ base pay rate, among other recommendations, as it seeks to lower prices of rides in one of its largest markets.】

item.title: 养老院运营商 PACS 在《兴登堡空头报告》发布后暴跌

item.description: 随着数十年来贸易限制的影响逐渐显现，美国南部有望超越加拿大在北美木材业长期占据的主导地位。【原文：The southern US is poised to surpass Canada’s long-held dominance over the North American lumber industry as decades of trade restrictions take a toll.】

item.description: 随着美国朝着另一个旷日持久且可能存在争议的选举结果驶去，一个问题笼罩着华盛顿的办公室、纽约的新闻机构和硅谷的社交网络：如果唐纳德-特朗普再次过早地宣布自己获胜，会发生什么？【原文：With the US barreling toward another protracted and potentially disputed election result, one question hangs over offices across Washington, news organizations in New York, and social networks in Silicon Valley: What happens if Donald Trump again prematurely declares himself the winner?】
